benchmark_details.name: mOSCAR (Multimodal Open Super-large Crawled Aggregated corpus)
benchmark_details.overview: mOSCAR is the first large-scale multilingual and multimodal document corpus, covering 163 languages, with 303M documents, 200B tokens, and 1.15B images, specifically developed to support research in multimodal large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale, high-quality multilingual and multimodal dataset for training and evaluating multilateral large language models.

data.source: Crawled from the web using Common Crawl datasets with extensive filtering for quality and safety.
data.annotation: Manual filtering and evaluation steps to ensure dataset safety and quality.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on standard evaluation protocols for image-text tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Results are compared against models trained on standard captions and evaluated on various multilingual tasks.
methodology.validation: Extensive filtering and evaluation procedures to ensure reliability and quality of the dataset.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Documents processed to remove PII and toxic content.
